website_summaries.verdict: Users are passionate about this high-torque impact wrench, which handles factory-tightened bolts on mowers, autos, and more with ease.
pros: High power is essential to removing stubborn fasteners
Low-power setting is just right for tasks like starting bolts
Many compare its power to an air wrench
cons: Sockets are hard to attach to updated ring attachment design

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant in buying this since Milwaukee is known to make tools for construction work mainly. I needed a 1/2" impact driver to remove wheel lugs off of cars and trucks but didn't want to spend over 5-600 for a snap-on. I took a gamble with it cause of the price but also cause I have all Milwaukee tools for construction work as well. Gotta say this thing does the job and more even for automotive work! Very strong, just pair it with a 5.0 or higher battery for longer lasting! I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is in a spot that I was about buying this for other types of work.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lieu

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes too much!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast handles every job I throw at it. Including breaking bolts and putting things back together or taking them apart to replace the bolt you just broke. Really it is a impact gun and only use this if you need a lot of power or have used impact guns before. The only downside it is heavy and a little too big for some tight areas where a air powered impact gun might fit. I have both so I can't complain too much but the cordless thing is priceless. If you do buy this get the 5.0 or 9.0 batteries or it's not worth it. The power comes from the batteries so they do matter.
customer_reviews.author: This guy

customer_reviews.title: GET ONE NOW !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has balls dude ! Don't kid yourself thinking that your snapon is better ... This thing out performs two of my friends snapons for a fraction of the cost for the tool and batteries ...
customer_reviews.author: Gtijoe

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old Snap On electric impact
customer_reviews.text: I am a crane service technician. Better than my old Snap On electric impact. Tons of power to remove stubborn fasteners. The low power setting is great for starting bolts and running them down to hand tight without damaging the threads or the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Nearly 5 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: This thing is still a beast after nearly 5 years of ownership. Once in awhile I have to flip the forward and reverse switch back and forth because it seems like it loses contact. I probably just need to clean the thing. Otherwise, this impact has been through a beating over the past 5 years and is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: JuAn

customer_reviews.title: had a snapon...
customer_reviews.text: First of all I got the snap on gun for free. 7650? It did it's job well and died one day. I think a brush was wedged. Snapon will definitely want too much to service the gun. The damage to the gun is my own fault for using imbalanced Tekton impact sockets on it. With this milwaukee I won't repeat that mistake. 1100 break away torque in the palm of my hand. Break practically any nut with exception to the inevidable clinched nut which wont change my 5 star rating. I go to work with it and take it home just incase. Mechanic on the go.
customer_reviews.author: PhilatLVanORLanNY

customer_reviews.title: Tons of power!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy equipment technician here. This is my go to impact now. My snap on air guns only make it out of the truck for the toughest fasteners. This is so much more convienant than dragging out a hose. This thing packs a real punch and breaks just about anything loose.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great impact
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I have a farm and work with large, tight bolts all the time. This is the impact wrench that could. It handles everything with ease. Be aware, it is not light. When you pick it up, you know you have something in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Keys

customer_reviews.title: An Animal compared to my old pneumatic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my aging Craftsman pneumatic impact driver. It is an amazing tool. The only bad thing I could say about it is that it is somewhat heavier than a pneumatic driver, but not having to worry about having a good source of compressed air is worth the tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: Melrose Plant

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: If you already have Milwaukee tools and batteries, then this is the impact gun for you! I have busted the most stubborn nuts and bolts on my truck (95 F150) with no effort on my part. This gun does it all! It was even able to loosen the infamous radius arm bushing nut. In general, a battery powered impact gun is so much more convenient than dealing with hoses and compressors. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen T.

customer_reviews.title: This impact is no Joke
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I bought this impact It's very powerful to say the least. I have two older 1/2" drive Milwaukee's and they still work great. This one is no Joke it doesn't play all business. When I first got it I put it on a lower control arm nut with a non impact socket and it split the socket in two pieces. What I didn't notice was the nut was welded to the frame. I recommend to all you won't unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: G8 GT 6L.

customer_reviews.title: Red devil torque beast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Got one for myself and now one for my father in law. Haven't had a fastener this thing can't tackle yet! Lug nuts, rusty exhaust components, pinion nut, even rusty bolts through a hitch into the frame that have been through 15 Michigan winters! The tool runs great, is reliable, and plenty powerful. Would absolutely recommend to anyone who is looking for a portable 1/2" drive impact.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Buy it and don't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is bad ass. I tossed around getting the 3/4" drive but I'm happy with this one. It's already saved me a boat load of time. I use it for work. I work on natural gas pipelines and use it for breaking/tightening bolts. It will handle just about anything from a 10" flange (2" nut) and lower. I think it has already paid for itself in the time it has saved me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé is a diesel mechanic and he has been using this for 2 months now. The thing is nasty, dirty, gets kicked around the shop floor and is used about 20 times a day. Still going strong. He loves it, and says that this is one of the most used tools. No performance issues, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Beltanette

customer_reviews.title: BadASS
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, but kicks serious ass. I bought it because i had a bolt on my RV that I tried everything to get off by hand and with standard impact. I used a 2' pipe on my socket, sprayed with liquid wrench, all kinds of stuff that usually works and couldn't get it to budge. This thing broke it loose literally in a split second.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Air tool replacement
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This tool beats all my air tools. It is very durable for the year that I have had it. There is nothing that this thing has not broken loose. I also like the low torque mode so that I can quickly tighten lug not, without the worry of over tightening.
customer_reviews.author: TheEEContractor

customer_reviews.title: More Torque than Snap On
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best impact out there. I am a Mechanic and it get used hard. The Milwaukee impact has been dropped numerous times, covered in oil, and ran over with a truck and it still works and has as much torque as brand new. When the other technicians $800 Snap On impacts cant get a bolt out they ask for the Milwaukee. If this impact ever quits I will not hesitate to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Dexter

customer_reviews.title: This will replace my pneumatic 1/2 drive impact.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast of a cordless impact. I used it on my buddies 1 ton Dodge duelly lug nuts with no problem at all. Be warned though. To take advantage of the power this tool has, you need to use the 5.0 or 9.0 amp Milwaukee M 18 battery for best results.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I've been a mechanic for almost 30 years and this ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been a mechanic for almost 30 years and this is the strongest 1/2" impact I've ever owned. I almost never use my air impacts anymore!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan F.

customer_reviews.title: Great impact wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast when it comes to a battery operated impact. I have had this for some time now and it never fails to do the job. It's great to have two settings for tightening because the high setting really tightens bolts and nuts. I use the lower setting to put bolts and nuts on so they won't over tighten. I haven't found anything yet that it will not remove. A GREAT impact!!!!
customer_reviews.author: k735explorer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great impact
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great impact, a little on the heavy side but the battery acts as a nice counterweight. Weight is not an issue for me - I really enjoy the mode 1 100 torque limit, mode 2 full power.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Adam Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Easily removed the factory tightened Scag mower blade nuts/bolts that ...
customer_reviews.text: Easily removed the factory tightened Scag mower blade nuts/bolts that could not be removed by hand... way too tight... This is why I bought this... used the small 2 amp-hour battery from my Milwaukee cordless drill... No issues with the order, delivery, or the tool... Dave...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T.

customer_reviews.title: Enough torque to really do some damage.
customer_reviews.text: This was for personal use and firing up a huge air compressor to run a 1/2" impact wasn't practical or especially pleasant to be around in the garage. This bad boy has enough power and stays charged long enough that you'll never miss the air impact.
customer_reviews.author: alon

customer_reviews.title: Monster impact.
customer_reviews.text: This impact wrench is a bit of a beast. I was shocked at how beefy/heavy it is. I've only used it with the 2.0 bats but even with those it works as advertised. Plenty of impact power even with the smaller batteries.
customer_reviews.author: JohnG

customer_reviews.title: This thing busted out the lug nuts off of our ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing busted out the lug nuts off of our trailer that got soaked in a flood and sat for a year. A bit on the heavy side. but hey, it beats the curs'in and swearing with other tools. Plus it's portable.
customer_reviews.author: LABiker

customer_reviews.title: Still going!
customer_reviews.text: Gobs of torque for the car user. Has not faltered at any rusted, or overtorqued nut!! I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and more than happy with it
customer_reviews.text: If you have a job for a 1/2" impact, just buy this. I did reviews and cost comparisons, then bought it and used it, and more than happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jhanses

customer_reviews.title: Have had multiple people tell me "you're gonna struggle with those bolts" after they've used their corded impacts and this one clack-clack-clack breaks it free with them amazed.
customer_reviews.text: What a beast! Have had multiple people tell me "you're gonna struggle with those bolts" after they've used their corded impacts and this one clack-clack-clack breaks it free with them amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best, mostly commonly used tool I own
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best, mostly commonly used tool I own. Out-powers even my best IR 1/2" air impact. I don't know how I lived without this.
customer_reviews.author: Hephaestus

customer_reviews.title: fantastic tool for rusty fastners
customer_reviews.text: I cant say enough good things about this. I am a avid DIYer and I cant afford a nice air compressor with impact gun.With this tool,I dont think i need it and the battery life longevity is even more amazing.I am truly amazed with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: nigel

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought this a long time ago. It makes it so easy to rotate tires and it does not pause on the lug nuts. Now I don't have to power up air compressor and drag the hose that always get in the way. This is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Wish i woulda waited
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Wish i woulda waited. I paid 500 on amazon when it came oit barely used it. Now 200. Deffinately worth it!! Especially for price now
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: talk about torque
customer_reviews.text: use it to change flats on 3/4 ton and cattle trailer. used it several times and can change a tire like a NASCAR pit crew. love it . lots of torque and good battery life. battery charger is a little pricey i thought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snapped the stud off his jeep like a chicken neck
customer_reviews.text: Let my kid use it. Told him to use level 1 only putting his lug nuts back on. Snapped the stud off his jeep like a chicken neck! This tool is bad ass!
customer_reviews.author: Northman

customer_reviews.title: One of the best impact on the market today
customer_reviews.text: One of the best impact on the market today,A little heavy for my taste but it does the job i took out a Honda crankshaft and those that have acura or honda know how hard that is. i use it with the lisle harmonic balancer socket and it came out easily.great machine super powerful Kudos to Milwaukee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You better use impact sockets
customer_reviews.text: You better use impact sockets .... This thing will break a regular socket ... This thing is nasty bad ....... You will love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rooster

customer_reviews.title: For a cordless wrench I am completely impressed. I ...
customer_reviews.text: For a cordless wrench I am completely impressed. I had watched a video of other professional claiming there was nothing that couldn't be tightened or broke loose with this wrench. I proved it to myself when I used it on s suspension job. Only once did it pound more than 4 times before turned bolt. My air impact may be getting a long rest.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Glander

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome. Definitely glad I paid the money for this. You get what you pay for with this powerful product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Best Impact Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I use it whenever I can, you know it'll get anything off without breaking it or struggling. I live in Ohio where we get that Ohio Loctite (RUST!) going on and this hasn't failed me yet.
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Am very happy with M18 Fuel tools so far
customer_reviews.text: Am very happy with M18 Fuel tools so far. On the high torque setting, this seems to have plenty of torque even compared to my old air impact wrench but I can use it on my jobsite.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinglow

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Bought one for the house..... bought another for the ranch cause I can't live without it at either location...anyone want to buy some air impact wrenches?
customer_reviews.author: Jared F.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast, accidentally had it in ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast, accidentally had it in the wrong rotation and snapped a large bolt in a second lol. Whoops.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best investment you could make
customer_reviews.text: Best investment you could make. This impact can handle EVERYTHING. And the product warranty is the best I've heard of. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, the old one broke and I got ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, the old one broke and I got this one for him, it came very quick and haven't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sy1217

customer_reviews.title: Saves so much time doing work on the car.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with my older m18 batteries - the 4 amp-hour kind from the original M18 line about 4 years old, not the "fuel" type. Makes doing front end work on my car/van almost enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: p-rose

customer_reviews.title: Removed lug-nuts on a work truck set @ 120 ft/lbs ...
customer_reviews.text: Removed lug-nuts on a work truck set @ 120 ft/lbs with no trouble on all four tires. Put them back on lightly and then used torque wrench with out using even one bar on the battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: TONY Box

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee! Always great tools
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to help remove about any bolt or nut with, a touch heavy but works outstanding, I have placed a 5.0 battery on it for extended run time.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much but am very impressed with the power.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R

customer_reviews.title: i love this little impact
customer_reviews.text: lots of power without having to drag around an air hose and fire up the compressor! i love this little impact.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: Lots of torque
customer_reviews.text: This thing will blow away my pneumatic IR impact, only downside is it is heavy
customer_reviews.author: CAN

customer_reviews.title: it has a lot of torque
customer_reviews.text: this thing does the job i don't even pick up my mac 1/2 " impact any more this things got some ass in it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Matousek

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best electric impact wrench available
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best electric impact wrench available. It came highly recommended and I have used it a lot and love it. I tried a Ryobi impact wrench but it was far to weak so I returned it for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Another solid Milwaukee tool. I have many of their 12v and 18v tools and just like the rest this impact wrench does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Cain929

customer_reviews.title: this thing is fantastic! it has two power settings
customer_reviews.text: this thing is fantastic! it has two power settings...i don't even use the higher power anymore. it spun a seat bolt right off the floor of my truck truck.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best cordless impact, period.
customer_reviews.text: If you need serious torque in a cordless gun this is your best option. I looked around and this was the best price I could fine. Serious piece of hardware, well built and will break any bolt you hook it up to.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Allen

customer_reviews.title: This tool has way too much power for a normal ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool has way too much power for a normal household use. But if you need to take off tractor tires or other serious bolts this is the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: roll cyclones

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I bought it for a big project and was very pleased with its power and the battery life. It has induced me to expand into other Milwaukee M18 tools.
customer_reviews.author: R. Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Great impact very strong and dependable so far
customer_reviews.text: This impact is awesome it takes the same battery as my 3/8 impact it's as strong as an air impact.my son purchased a snap-on 1/2 impact and spent a lot more on it.this is just as strong.I have not had it long enough for a true test yet
customer_reviews.author: Brian McHugh Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Kix Butt
customer_reviews.text: bada** tool, Love Milwaukee tools, and E-service! ... a little heavy, but that's the power in your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Cherubimwings

customer_reviews.title: It's a Milwaukee! Of course it works well
customer_reviews.text: It's a Milwaukee! Of course it works well. Plenty of torque. We use this for our camper and it will lower the jack while lifting the 10,000 pound camper with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Fish

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!  Milwaukee stands behind their products!
customer_reviews.text: I used the heck out of this since I bought it and it finally had to be sent in for repair. filled out the registration online and mailed it back to Milwaukee and about 10 days went by and I have it back again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: If You Need a lot of Torque on battery power...
customer_reviews.text: It's a beast, will do more than is required, put a 9.0 ah battery on it. What a deal, bought it without a case, saved enough to buy the battery, Thx!
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: its got MOAR POWER. setting one has been reliable ...
customer_reviews.text: its got MOAR POWER. setting one has been reliable for me, for tightening lug nuts. Using with a 9 amp battery.
customer_reviews.author: Maeggie

customer_reviews.title: Last impact you'll ever buy. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: WOW. This tool is amazing. So much torque better then any air tool. I would not regret buying this tool. And with a 5 year warranty you can lose. I would buy the rubber case to protect this baby.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: You will not find a better impact. I purchased the impact
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better impact. I purchased the impact,two batteries and a charger, saved over one hundred dollars, I use a padded,soft side tool bag that was left over from a drill, fits great.
customer_reviews.author: SPEEDRACER54

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easily removes lugs on my truck that are torqued to 160 FT LBS. BTW, get the cover P/N 49-16-2763
customer_reviews.author: Frosty Mug

customer_reviews.title: this works better than an impact wrench
customer_reviews.text: For me, this works better than an impact wrench. More powerful than I expected. Great for lugnuts and suspension bolts.

customer_reviews.title: Impact from the gods
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing cordless impact ever made - you will only be impressed

customer_reviews.title: Best electric impact on the market

customer_reviews.title: If u want a the best this is for the big boys
customer_reviews.text: If u want a the best this is for the big boys .This is so strong it broke a shock absorber bolt from my car but that was my fault showing off the torque to my brother.

customer_reviews.text: My coworker has this beast. I knew I had to get my hands on one. We build power substations and this bad boy can loosen anything there is. Very pleased.

customer_reviews.title: It will blow your mind.
customer_reviews.text: After a year of abuse, this thing rivals ANY air or electric Slap-on or IR gun you own. Sure its a bit bulky, but when mated with the 5.0 battery it will break loose, or just snap off just about anything! Its unbelievable portable power. Rusty 15 year old axle nuts... Phhh! This thing will tear it off with ease! I can do 4 complete tire rotations and the battery is only down 25% (3 of the 4 lights on) If you're THINKING 'maybe ill buy this thing' JUST DO IT!

product_meta.title: Milwaukee 2763-20 M18 Fuel 1/2-Inch High Torque Impact Wrench with Friction Ring (Bare Tool)
product_meta.description: M18 Fuel 1/2 Htiw W/Ring Bare. The Product is Easy to Use and Easy to Handle. The Product is Highly Durable. Made In China.
feature_bullets: Superior performance: Delivers up to 700 ft-lbs of maximum fastening torque, up to 1,100 ft-lbs of nut-busting torque and up to 2X more runtime
POWERSTATE Brushless Motor: Outpowers competitors yet runs cooler with no wearable components

REDLINK PLUS Intelligence: allows the operator to choose between 2 fastening modes with Milwaukee’s proprietary DRIVE CONTROL feature. Mode 1 delivers up to 100 ft-lbs of maximum fastening torque, and Mode 2 up to 700 ft-lbs maximum fastening torque
REDLITHIUM XC5.0 Battery Pack (not included): Provides superior pack construction, electronics and performance to deliver 2X more runtime
1/2” Anvil with friction ring for fast, easy socket changes, Warranty: 5 Years
Switch Type: Variable Speed Trigger, Anvil Size and Type: 1/2" Square - Friction Ring, Voltage: 18V
